meanings.definition: The anterior opening of an animal's digestive tract.
meanings.sent1: The prostomia of the fish allows it to eat food.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the prostomia of various insects.
meanings.sent3: The prostomia of the worm made it the envy of all its friends.
meanings.sent4: The prostomia of the snake seemed to beckon its prey.
meanings.sent5: The prostomia, like a welcoming door, led to the creature's stomach.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of a mouth at the front end of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The prostomia of the strange creature puzzled the researchers.
meanings.sent2: The prostomia of the monster was its most striking feature.
meanings.sent3: The prostomia of the alien made it difficult for it to wear hats.
meanings.sent4: The prostomia of the beast was like a hungry portal.
meanings.sent5: The prostomia, like a curious entrance, defined the creature's uniqueness.

meanings.definition: The presence of a mouth at the beginning of a body cavity.
meanings.sent1: The prostomia of the organism was where it took its first bite.
meanings.sent2: The prostomia of the mammal was carefully examined by the veterinarian.
meanings.sent3: The prostomia of the monster made it a hit at parties.
meanings.sent4: The prostomia of the creature seemed to whisper secrets.
meanings.sent5: The prostomia, like a hungry gate, awaited its next meal.
